title: How to stop notifications from Google ‘Important’ folder?
content:
Thunderbird has, for a while now, been giving me multiple notifications for the same message and keeps doing so over and over. I don’t see the point in getting a notification about a message more than once. Obviously, TB does flag ‘newness’ as well as ‘unread’ so it would be best if notifications took ‘newness’ into account.

Even if notifications do rely on a message being ‘unread’, Google’s IMAP folder system makes sure that messages appear in more than one place, which seems to make Thunderbird give you more than one notification. Is there any way to restricting what folders TB looks in for new messages to notify you about?
creator: seanos

content:

Controllare la password e verificare il “Metodo di autenticazione” in “Impostazioni account | Server posta in uscita (SMTP)”.

I need help quickly because I am a lawyer and I use thunderbird to send my documents to the Court best regards Avv Marianna Forlani

title: TBird can't read subfolders. After run update just current.
content:
I've decide to switch from old Claws Mail. It is TBird 102.11.0 (64-bit) on Xubuntu 22.04

After run the TBird update only previous pointed sub-folder and Inbox. If I point to other one TBird report "Login to account failed" asking me for new password or cancel or retry. If I shutdown the TBird and open it again the new pointed (from prev start) folder updates automatically.

But if I choice other one - the result is the same - "Login to account failed" and system message: "Server imap.... has disconnected. The server may have gone down or there may be a network problem"

Seems TBird don't communicate in the right way with the imap server. I can't see anything in settings to help me. Maybe someone from community can? Thank you in advance!
creator: lbakalov

title: How do I fix the drag and drop option with wacom-tablet? It has stopped working.
content:
Since I updated from Ubuntu 20 to Ubuntu 22.04, Thunderbird has become unstable when using a wacom-style tablet: every time I try to drag and drop an email, it crashes. It also doesn't respond well to the wacom pen buttons. Other software seems to work well. I tried safe mode disabling all add-ons, and same result. On the terminal, I see this error when it happens:

[Parent **, Main Thread] WARNING: gdk_wayland_window_get_wl_surface: assertion 'GDK_IS_WAYLAND_WINDOW (window)' failed: 'glib warning', file /build/thunderbird-pdSW0V/thunderbird-102.11.0+build1/toolkit/xre/nsSigHandlers.cpp:167

(thunderbird:**): Gdk-CRITICAL **: ***: gdk_wayland_window_get_wl_surface: assertion 'GDK_IS_WAYLAND_WINDOW (window)' failed [GFX1-]: Wayland protocol error: error marshalling arguments for start_drag (signature ?oo?ou): null value passed for arg 1

[GFX1-]: Wayland protocol error: Error marshalling request: Invalid argument

Gdk-Message: ***: Error 22 (Invalid argument) dispatching to Wayland display. Exiting due to channel error.
creator: aiora.zabala

Thx for any help! ~M

title: How to back up my emails in Thunderbird before changing my email provider?
content: I have to switch to another email provider. But the old provider does not allow me to back up my emails and later re-import them at the new provider. I have been using IMAP for all my emails. So when I change the settings in Thunderbird to the new email provider's settings, I assume that in Thunderbird, all my older emails will be deleted (when Thunderbird synchs my account with the new email provider, and the old emails are not there, I assume all older emails will be deleted from Thunderbird?). How can I avoid losing my old emails during the migration? I have already created subfolders to my Local Folders (Backup/email1, etc), and copied all my emails there. Is that enough? Those would not disappear during a switch of email providers, right? Also, I work with a laptop on the road, and a desktop from at home, and I have no access to the desktop machine at his time. How can I transfer the backed-up emails from my Local Folder to the desktop computer later?
creator: tenjuergen

title: Agenda
content: Hi, I encounter since the last but not the last upgrade an issue with agenda and, as I suppose, with recurent events. Looks like Thunderbird agenda is not able to clear one or more occurences within a dates range and when you try to synchronize with an other calendar app Thunderbird agenda definitely crashes. In such a situation Thunderbird run and run during very long time but, at the end (5 to 10 mn later) you may interact with the mail, but very slowly. and the processor (Intel 7 octocore 3.2 GHz) is busy at the level of 50 to 75%. No difference when I use the troubleshooting mode. I only may use the mail after stopping agenda an restart Thunderbird. I already uninstall then reinstall Thunderbird, but no effect ( my data were agin present). I would be glad to receive help to fix this issue. Kind regards, Michel Poinssot

title: How can I deduplicate a subfolder?
content:
The email system that my organisation uses does not have an "All Mail" folder, and any folder I want has to be created as a subfolder of the Inbox. That is not Thunderbird's fault. It just an annoying constraint of our system. Ultimately the original emails are then moved from the Inbox and filed in their relevant folders, while the copy remalns in the All Mail folder.

My workaround is to select and copy batches of emails in my Thunderbird Inbox to an "All Mail" subfolder that I have created. However sometimes I copy the same Inbox email more than once to the subfolder. Is there a way to deduplicate the emails in a single folder, namely my All Mail folder?

I use Thunderbird on a Windows 10 PC and on iPad and iPhone.
creator: David_DD

title: 3.3 MB Pasted Image becomes 22 MB Message
content:
TB 102.13.0 (64-bit)/macOS 13.3 (22E252)/2023 MBP, 16", M2 Max

If I take a photo on my iPhone 12 SE/iOS 16.5.1 and AirDrop it to my Mac, it's 3.3 MB:

https://www.kan.org/pictures/IMG_8281.HEIC

If I attach it to a message (as an attachment) in TB, the message size is about 4 MB.

If I copy/paste it into the message body, the message size balloons to ~22 MB. You can test this just by Saving the message to your Drafts folder; you don't have to actually send it.

Resizing the pasted photo within the message body doesn't affect the message size, as it appears to change the rendering without resampling.

The result is the same whether I copy on the iPhone and paste it into TB on my Mac, or whether I AirDrop it to my Mac, open in Preview, copy from Preview, and paste into TB.

Is there a way to resample the image within TB to reduce its file size without going through another app like Preview? Sometimes it's more instructive to have inline messages, exactly where they need to be in the body of my email, rather than having them as attachments. And copy/paste directly from my iPhone would be a great productivity enhancer if not for the size bloat.

Thanks!
creator: steven64

title: Message filters not working
content:
To whom it may concern,

Since I'm using Thunderbird I've been building a Message Filter (Tools> Message Filters) to automatically delete mails by setting up rules like, i.e., delete messages containing certain words and/or symbols in its address and/or subject. This feature has been performing perfectly until a few days ago, when this rules stopped working—hence these unwanted mails reach my Inbox, also my Junk folder. Manually executing those filters neither works. I've updated Thunderbird to its latest version in Ubuntu, 102.13, although this issue persists. Could you please provide me any hint about what's happening?

Thanks for your patience and support.

Best regards,

Sebastián

PS: I've attached a screenshot of a mail that, according to "my rules", should have been automatically deleted.
